review: I just wanted to leave a quick review highlighting the one functionality of the Fire TV that made it a winner for me.  I switched from a Roku 3 that I had been using for a year to the Fire TV.  The sole functionality that won me over was the addition of Spotify Connect technology (combined with the optical audio output).  What that allowed me to do is run the HDMI to my TV and run the optical output straight to my stereo integrated amplifier with the desired outcome being the ability to stream music without having to have my television on. It allows you to 1) navigate and control Spotify using the interface native to the controlling device (in this case an Ipad Air and a Motorola Moto X) while 2) not having my personal devices do the actual streaming as would be the case with bluetooth and I believe Airplay technologies.  That saves you a bit of battery life plus leaves your controlling device more responsive to other things you might want to do with them.  From the video side I pretty much just use Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, Crackle, PBS and Hulu - the Amazon hardware seems to be faster than the Roku box but I will say not having the voice search work on Netflix is irritating (Question for Amazon: how do you think paying for content from Amazon that I am getting from an existing subscription fee would in any way make me a happier customer?).  In back to back comparisons I detected a slightly better video quality from the Fire TV.  Making the voice search cross platform compatible would make this device a strong 5 star contender.  My guess is that happens when Roku puts out their next device that does just that.  In the end, the media that I buy does come from Amazon - I just don't want to accidentally buy something I could stream for free.  Either way, I recommend the Fire TV, particularly for Spotify Premium subscribers.
author: Chris Hopkins "newcastle68"
